intro: Heliotropium curassavicum subsp. obovatum, commonly known as the broad-leaf heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate to obovate leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple. Its flowers open in response to sunlight, a trait known as heliotropism. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
